result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J Grieger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall have no contact with the victim Jason V or Fleet Farm.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including an AODA assessment and treatment.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit random drug screens of his blood, breath or urine.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.
Defendant shall have no contact with any place/establishment where illegal drugs are packaged, purchased, sold or distributed.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.
Defendant shall pay all outstanding financials previously ordered.  Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate to be determined by DOC and the balance due as a condition of Extended Supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
